Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gtinckler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights and was pleasantly surprised at the good value of this hotel. It is very good value for the money. It was quite quiet and had a better breakfast included than I expected. The elevators could use an update as well as the ice machine on the 4th floor (loud & did not work well) but these are minor things. All in all, I would definitely stay here again. If you are looking for super-fancy then look elsewhere but if you want a clean place to stay that is good value, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: POWERTOOLGUY
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night here. The over all appearance of the hotel and room was clean. Great staff...very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: GoodbyeSnow
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice appearance. The rooms are clean but the walls are not insulated well enough. You can actually hear what your neighbors are saying and what tv show they are watching. After a busy day you just want a nice quite place to rest which does not happen. The pool area is well maintained and the hot tub is great after a long day. The breakfast was really nice and well stocked and looked after. If it was not for the paper thin walls I would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, close to Disney!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica P
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, sisters and I stayed at this hotel Easter weekend for my birthday trip to Orlando. While the hotel is a little off the beaten path, it's probably a five minute drive to the parks. The hotel is very clean and spacious. The staff was friendly, and the free breakfast was great - eggs, bacon, biscuits, juice, cereal and pancakes! The rooms were large (we had two queen beds) and clean as well. The only problem was that the walls are PAPER THIN! We even had security yell at us for being too loud around 12:30, 1am when we got back to our hotel room. I didn't think we were being that loud, but the security guard was up to our room within 10 minutes of our arrival. And sure enough at 7:30am, we heard our neighbor's children bouncing on the beds and yelling. The thin walls are definitely the only downfall of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Friendly Staff - Really Thin Walls.....”
Reviews.Author: chheal
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews say, the walls in this hotel are thin. Really thin. You can hear everything. Otherwise, the hotel is above average for this class. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The room was clean. The furnishings as of April 2012 are probably mid-life and in acceptable condition with one exception. This hotel still has CRT TV's. For the price, I would expect a flat screen and HD service. But this isn't a hotel where you will spend much time in the room. In sum, the hotel is a good choice that isn't outstanding, but is above average.

Reviews.Title: “Octavia”
Reviews.Author: martin0910
Reviews.Content: She got me breakfast after they closed the buffet - a heaping plate of eggs, bacon, etc. And she was happy to do it. Octavia, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: diamondoh84
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for a week in February under the employee discount program. We enjoyed it very much. The staff was very friendly, especially Dhru (pronounced Drew) They put us at the end of the hall so we only had to hear one neighbor as opposed to 2 as most of the reviews talk about the very thin walls. Neighbors talking wasnt too bad but the flushing of the toilets was. The location was perfect. 10 minutes will get you most places you want to go to. The breakfast was good. They swapped sausage and bacon every other day and the pancake machine was cool. I believe we will be back to this hotel next time were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Max B
Reviews.Content: Not sure where the bad publicity comes from on this hotel, probably competing hotels in the area using their employees to write bad reviews. Great stay, awesome breakfast, staff was awesome. Its also a Disney Good Neighbor hotel, so there are certain standards they must maintain.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: suchjill
Reviews.Content: I thought based on the reviews that this would be a nicer place. The hotel was very noisy and the walls way too thin. We planned to go to Disney the next day and we all got very little sleep. There are too many other options in the area to choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Florida near Disney World Park”
Reviews.Author: VPandya
Reviews.Content: We were on a vacation in Florida and we stayed at the Holiday-Inn (Express) in Kissimmee for 7-Nights and 8-days. It was a great experience. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. It was first time for us in Florida, so when it comes to exploring it we have to rely mostly on local’s guidance; and hotel staff Wendy, Heta, Claudia and Dhruv were very patient and guiding us whenever we had any questions. At the same time, the room was very comfortable with excellent amenities. The hotel has a great outside pool and Jacuzzi, indoor laundry, fitness facility, a game room and located very nearby to one big departmental store as well as one outlet plaza. It has great breakfast, I still miss Cinnamon Bun and nicely brewed coffee. Our morning starts with glorious smile and warm “good morning” greeting from the reception staff as well as Breakfast serving staff. From plenty options and many places to choose from in Disney World and surrounding area, I would say that I have made a wise decision to stay in the Holiday-Inn Express in Kissimmee. If I ever visit again, I will definitely stay at this hotel and at the same time will recommend this hotel to my families and friends. It’s a worth staying at this hotel, you’ll never go wrong choosing this location of Holiday-Inn.

Reviews.Title: “clean property conveniently located good value”
Reviews.Author: dandeja
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in February 2012. We had a King, our friends had a suite. The rooms were clean and well appointed. Staff were friendly and helpful - always important. We couldn't get CNN on the TV for some reason, a negative in my book. Coffee, fridge, microwave in all rooms Factory outlets across the street, Walmart across the street. Orlando Premium Outlets and several restaurants within 10 minutes. Disney 10 minutes. I-4 five minutes. (a bit over an hour to Busch Gardens). The south end of International drive 5 minutes. Breakfast included and it was a good selection. A couple of strip malls right next door were a bit dicey.Excellent value. If you have to do the Disney thing, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay and Not the Last”
Reviews.Author: Eskay75
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Very Close to DisneyWorld (about 5 minutes) and Sea World (about 10-15 minutes). - Steps away from 24/7 Walmart - Very Close to Lake Buena Vista Factory Outlets and Vineland Premium Outlets - Minutes away from Irlo Bronson Ave. where you can find every shopping/food you want in each direction. - Free Wi-Fi with very good reception. - Hot Breakfast with good variety - Large size rooms with 2 room suites available. - Microwave/coffee maker and Fridge in all rooms. - AC works great (old style thats connected below the window in single room, central with thermostat in suites) - Hotel grounds, lobbies, breakfast areas and rooms/bathrooms are all CLEAN!!!! - Friendly staff, really make effort to know you. - Very well lit parking lot. - Nice, fenced in, pool area. - Coin Laundry on two floors. - Disney Parks concierge on site. Cons: - Paper thin walls. You WILL hear everything. I found that by keeping the AC Unit's fan running creates enough white noise to block out most outside noise. - Very well lit parking lot (yes this is both a pro and con). Pro for safety on site, Con because the drapes do a poor job of keeping light out. But if you dont like sleeping in total darkness, you wont need a night light. When your tired its not a big deal anyway. - TV is limited to local cable channels (not a big deal unless you spend hours watching TV on your vacation). - Safes are not in room, but behind the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers!!”
Reviews.Author: SockMonkey67
Reviews.Content: Room and hotel are clean, staff is conscientious and location is great. However, if you are like me and don't want to hear every cough, footstep and flush of your neighbors, this NOT the place for you!! This is third night here and I'm sleep deprived.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, but One HUGE Flaw”
Reviews.Author: Pogostic
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot. I've stayed in more than 20 hotels this year. I can't in good conscience recommend this one. The staff is lovely and I found the room rather clean. Normally that'd be enough for me. So, they have subpar TVs and satellite. I can deal. What I can't take is hearing every cough, every flush, and every snippet of conversation from my neighbor. I can hear every word. Somewhere above me, someone has a church program on and I might as well be in the room. Who built this place? It looks pretty, but the walls are only there so we don't see each other naked. They must be insulated with rice cakes. Great location, nice people, clean. It'd be perfect if you couldn't hear your neighbors potty trips. How can they fix it? I don't know if they can.

Reviews.Title: “Some concern”
Reviews.Author: Largo112
Reviews.Content: Room, staff, were good. TV had satellite channels that were not that great in quality. Walls are pretty thin and noise from upstairs and the hallway were bothersome. Breakfast was not up to par for a Holiday Inn. Price was excessive for the quality, but this is one of their busiest weeks of the year so all the hotels jacked their prices way up. Worst part was my daughter left a hoodie in the room. Not all that valuable money wise, but it was of some sentimental value. Now, she shouldn't have left it, however we called later and were told by the front desk that nobody turned anything in from that room. That tells me a lot about the hotel's standards and the ethics of its staff and management. I won't be staying there again, and I am now concerned about staying at other hotels of this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple”
Reviews.Author: pineapple_dee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiance from december 18th to the 25th. Check-in was smooth, the front desk peeps are very friendly and helpful, especially Aiza (I hope that's the right spelling!). Our room was clean and we didn't have any issues with the A/C unit. Towels were replaced daily as well which was nice. We had room 411 on the 4th floor. The free breakfast was conveniant, they had eggs, pancakes, sausage, bacon, coffee, juice, oatmeal, cereal, english muffins, etc. We always tried to go for breakfast before 7am to avoid the crowds. There's also a 24hr Walmart across the street that you can walk to which came in handy for buying snacks and cold drinks for our mini fridge. The hotel has a pool too but we didn't get a chance to try it out. My only complaint is the shuttle service to the parks. The one to Disney is fine, it drops you off at Epcot and you can take a Disney bus or monorail from there to the other parks. That shuttle came at 7:50am and 12noon at the hotel. What was annoying with this shuttle was that whenever the bus stops at another hotel for more passengers, they're never standing outside so we're sitting on the bus while the driver has to stop the vehicle, get off and go inside the lobby to get them. Those moments wasted a lot of time for nothing. The shuttle to Universal was so complicated and annoying. It came at 9:50am. We're standing outside and we ask the driver if this is the right bus. He tells us to wait a bit. Another bus comes and tells us he's going to Seaworld and the other guy to Universal when it was the other way around. So we got off the Seaworld one and had to run and signal the other guy to stop to let us on. Then the thing with picking up other people who aren't already outside and confusing them with the Seaworld thing. So we ending up stopping at Seaworld anyway because we had 3 people on our bus assuming we were going there. That ride took an hour to get to Universal Studios. I suggest that the hotel chooses a different company for the park transportation because we spent a lot of money on taxi cabs during this trip. Overall the hotel itself is great.

Reviews.Title: “don't understand the rave reviews”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Phil
Reviews.Content: I travel a bunch and stay at typically this class of hotel. The staff is quite good, good maid service, good front desk, room was is decent condition. Here are the "knocks"...the TVs in the room are older and the channel quality was inconsistent to the point of annoying. I had two sets in my room, one of the remotes did not work at all and the other only functioned partially. The bed was hard but I've slept on worse in europe. My biggest complaint is the workout room....terribly small, one VERY average treadmill (that I couldn't even get to work) and a non functioning a/c unit...horrible! Wouldn't stay here again...too many alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to parks”
Reviews.Author: biltonen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well worth the price. We chose not to use the shuttle service to Epcot because it was very limited. We did have a AAA diamond parking pass which was wonderful as it allowed us to park very close to the entrance to EPCOT and the ticket area for the Magic Kingdom. We did not have the breakfast except for coffee as the rooms come with a frig and microwave, so we brought our own food. Rooms were comfortable and clean, unfortunately when the rooms were cleaned it was ok, sometimes good, sometimes they left their cleaning products. The walls were paper thin, but since we read previous reviews, we simply asked for the top floor and corner room, which allowed us to have a very peaceful sleep. The staff were very nice and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Bad elevator smell, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bbiststeve
Reviews.Content: Both elevators had a really bad smell of machine oil and old sweat. After all day meetings and conference it was the last thing I wanted to experience on the way to my room. Breakfast was typical Holiday Inn Express and packed with kids and parents, so caution, very tight and long waits. The two times I had left at 11:30am I came back to a dirty room, the other three days I left at 7am and everything was fine. Very surprised this hotel can't have the housekeepers come back to clean the room after that or make sure I had fresh towels. Carpets had soiled spots, wouldn't even think about going barefoot in the room. Beds are old and not very comfortable. Convenient part is that there's a Walmart across the street if you need or forget anything, gas station and subway too. Location is near the freeway(s) so it was convenient getting to all my destinations. Front desk staff were all very nice and helpful. For the price paid I didn't expect very much and didn't get much so all in all it was pretty fair, except for the elevator smell. On a side note, buy a toll pass if you want to save time and not worry about stopping at every booth. Ended up saving me money with all the driving I did.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great service”
Reviews.Author: Tradersam
Reviews.Content: Staff went out of their way to makes us comfortable. Breakfast was complimentary and plentiful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: TCMallard
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, was a great place to come back to after long days at the parks. Had a great breakfast w/ lots to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER”
Reviews.Author: Gatorgirluf89
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel customer service I have ever experienced and it came from the general manager Heta. My daughter and I planned a trip to Orlando to take my 2 little nieces to Disney for Halloween. I booked my room well in advance and booked a room with 2 queen beds for 2 nights. We drove 6 hours to the hotel and when we got there we were told that we had a room with 1 king bed and it was for one night only. This is not what I booked and I had my confirmation number and iItinerary to show the front desk agent as I checked in. She told me that it was wrong. She told me there was nothing they could do for me and I asked her if there were any other holiday inn hotels around and she said she didn't know. She was extremely rude to me and my daughter and it was the worst experience that I have ever had. Come to find out she was the general manager of the hotel. It was very frusterating when you have two 6 year olds that just sat in a car for 6 hours and we were stranded in Orlando with no place to go. I cannot believe that the hotel wouldn't help us, wouldn't recommend another hotel or even try to help us.

Reviews.Title: “beware of bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: missjmeezy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here october 2010 during a visit to disneyworld with my boyfriend. I really didnt have any problems with the room except for the fact that we found a couple of bugs crawling by the foot of the bed. we didnt know what they were at first... they looked like dark brown/black lady bugs but flatter... we used a phone and googled bedbug and we were convinced that this place had them. we notified front desk and we were placed in another room. no problems in the new room except for lack of sleep!

Reviews.Title: “For the price, this is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: DessertsDivaFL
Reviews.Content: My two teens and I stayed one night here and we loved this hotel. First impression was that we didn't like the outside colors. But the whole property was clean and did not show any signs of being in need of repairs other than the walls on the 4th floor where a child had scratched a long mark along the walls. They couldn't do much with that since the walls are wallpapered. We were greated very warmly at the front desk. The gentleman was very accommodating and very sincere. He emphasized the hotel was "no smoking" which we loved because my son can have reactions to smoke. Our room was #422 which I highly recommend. It is on the end and oversees the pool area. It is a larger room and has two windows. It was not a suite but if you need space to store luggage, strollers, etc this is the room you want. I would assume that rooms #322 and #222 are set up the same way. The room itself was very spacious. The bathroom was large with lots of counter space. I prefer the sink being separate from the shower so two can get ready at the same time. But it wasn't any big deal for us. My daughter enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi. No one really used it much while we were there. Not sure why that was. We had two queen beds. The bed, for me, was too firm. Pillows were nice, TV channels acceptable, we did not use the micro and fridge but they were very clean, the computer desk was bigger than the rest of the furniture and stuck out into the walking area too far. That would be my only complaint about the room. The free breakfast in the morning was wonderful! They have a machine that automatically makes fresh, hot pancakes. Amazing! We had our choice of biscuits, sausage gravy, bacon, scrambled eggs, hot cinnamon buns, yogurt, cereal, toast, bagels, muffins, bananas (wish there was more fruit choices), juices (apple juice was watered down), coffee, instant oatmeal, instant hot chocolate, tea, milk and hard-boiled eggs. Sounds like a feast, right? Breakfast was crowded at 8:30 am so we had to eat in the conference room. Oh well, at least we had a place to sit. I didn't complain about the thin walls (yes, you can hear your neighbor's talk but not what they say) because that was up to the people building the hotel to make sure they did something about it. If you have your TV on or have the A/C running you don't here them but they may hear you if their room is quiet. Just keep that in mind if you book here. I do recommend this place but not for honeymooners (see comment above). This is a family-friendly hotel that is clean, comfortable and definitely worth what you pay. The location is just fine and is near to a Wal-Mart which we didn't know until we checked out. Happy vacationing!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Borisunflower
Reviews.Content: I recently stay at this hotel with my fiance for 4 days and 3 nights. When we arrived in the evening I gave the front desk guy my name and quickly recieved my room key with no problem. The room was very spacious and clean. There was a fridge and microwave in the room. There is an very nice outlet across the street from the hotel and down the strip is plently of restaurants and shops. My fiance and I went to this area called old town kissimmee it was a nice little area with lots of shops, amusement rides and games and also on fridays and saturdasy they have people that own vintage cars or muscle cars park in this designated area and they do a cruise of the cars. Overall they stay was great and the only complain I would have of this hotel is that both elevator had a very bad odor some what of mildew.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, clean and well priced with a super nice breakfast bar”
Reviews.Author: jojo34219
Reviews.Content: Very courteous staff, especially Kelley, the rooms are attractive and so is the entire hotel, one big downfall is how paper thin the walls and floors are; we stayed in a corner suite (451, very nice room) but we could here people next door and down the hallway, and also people going down the stairs. The breakfast is the main attraction here, very well supplied bar with excellent cinnamon rolls plus eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, pancakes, etc. If noise bothers you, you should definitely stay on the top floor for the most quiet stay. Location is prime right in between Walt Disney World and Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visitor”
Reviews.Author: Storm1908
Reviews.Content: My family first stayed at this property in 2009 for a trip to Walt Disney World (WDW). Because of my IHG Priority Club Platinum status, we were given a free upgrade to a junior sweet without having to request it. We returned to this property in May of this year for another trip to WDW and were just as pleased with our stay. The hotel location is in a quiet area, yet it's close enough to all of the theme parks. We were in a room with 2 queen beds and a queen sofa bed (which was rather hard, unfortunately). As seems to be a running theme with IHG properties, the breakfast didn't taste good, with the exception of the cinnamon rolls which are always great at Holiday Inn Express. The staff was nice. Now, I will admit that I was unhappy with the shuttle schedule which had been revamped since our last stay. It is very limited, but it is free. And, it's a crap shoot as to whether you'll get a friendly driver. (Funnily, they partially depend on tips.) However, we plan to return to Disney next year and have already booked a room here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad attitude! Trap and Threaten guests! Only 2 shuttles a day to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Hetty C
Reviews.Content: The first day i arrived at the hotel i received a poker face from the front desk person. Then she told me to sit there for a while while waiting for my room to be ready. She didn't tell me clearly where to sit, and on my itinerary it shows my reservation comes with complimentary breakfast. Therefore, i had the breakfast. The front desk person watched me eating and didn't inform me she will charge the breakfast at that time; instead, on the next day she told me she is gonna charge the breakfast. I was explaining to her I was not clearly told about that, but she immediately told me she is gonna call the police if i don't sign the charge agreement form. The worst service and experience i have ever received. Almost ruined my whole trip of Disney. The shuttles to Disney, Universal, and Sea World only comes 2 times a day, and takes more than 30 mins to destinations becuz it's picking up several other hotels' guests on the way. It's not convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean”
Reviews.Author: Anoini2
Reviews.Content: Had a really nice stay here at this resort hotel ($7 resort fee).  Great welcome goodies for priority club members.  A lot more than usual. They had a nice pool in between the two buildings.  Plenty amenities.  Although a little older than the other HIE, this is probably the cleanest I've stayed in.  Nice plush towels and crisp fresh linens that I can tell it was clean.  The bed was firm just the way I like it.  Some might think it could be too hard but it was perfect for me. I dont think it was new but even the sofa bed and chair and ottoman was clean.  I felt very comfortable in this hotel room.  There was a microwave and fridge and a mini sink.  Only strange thing is that they didn't have alotion but had a sewing kit.  Also the elevator was slow.  This is after trying VERY hard to find any negatives in this hotel.   Definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Yulietta11
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel!!!! The best in the area!! The pool, the room, the staff is good!!! Very nice people!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Blondie814
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff was great!! Always very nice and friendly,and even told us about area attractions. The rooms were nice and cozy but most of all CLEAN. I was very pleased with housekeeping and the fact that they don't bust your door down in the mornings trying to clean your room. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.The only minor downside is that the walls are thin and breakfast is served very early,but other than that it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Math2
Reviews.Content: We were 100% pleased with our stay at the Holiday Inn Express. Being a Priority Club member, we always request an upgrade, and are usually denied. When we checked in at this hotel, our upgrade had already been done! We were so pleased when we opened the hotel door to see a one bedroom suite! This was perfect since we were a party of 3 adults. The breakfast was excellent, and plentiful. there was ample seating. There were a couple of bus groups during our stay, and the hotel did a great job accommodating them without taking time from individual guests.

Reviews.Title: “Overall it was ok but there were a few negative points.”
Reviews.Author: Serena2808Essex
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite attractive from the outside, nice entrance & reception area. The staff were very friendly and always said hello & good bye when you passed thru the lobby. The pool was ok, a little basic but it was clean and was perfectly sufficient for cooling off on a hot day. The room was fairly nice, quite large with very comfortable beds (we had a twin room with 2 double beds), room also came with fridge & microwave which was very handy. The rooms were cleaned everyday to a very high standard and the cleaners even did nice little touches like line all my little girls toys up on her pillows. The location was great (as long as you have a car), pretty much a 15-20 minute drive from Disney Parks, 192, Int Dr, Orlando Premium Outlets. It was great to have breakfasts included too. The breakfasts were to a fairly good standard but unfortunately the same pretty much every day, however they filled me up so that was good enough. Now for the negatives. This hotel is not what I would call as being in Lake Buena Vista, I would say more like Kissimmee, our drive to the 192 was quicker than the drive to Downtown Disney. There is not much round the hotel (other than a Walmarts) so you would need a car to get out to restaurants etc. Finally... The walls are just too thin.You can pretty much hear everything in the neighbouring rooms. Generally the hotel went very quite from 11pm onwards so it wasnt too much of a problem for us, however if you ended up next door to someone who is up all night I dont think you would be getting much sleep. This is something that is quite bad, the worst I have ever known and the hotel should look into this and set about rectifying it.

Reviews.Title: “If you value your credit card information, don't stay here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jennyn1002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 times this month. Our first (the night before our Disney vacation) stay was good. It was clean, quiet and we got the rate we saw online with their price match. The second night (the night after our Disney vacation) was TERRIBLE. The room was not clean, the front desk guy was rude and refused to match the online rate and it was very noisy. Then we checked our bank account... I paid cash for both nights, but to make a reservation, you have to give a card number. I have my cash receipts, but my bank account was debited for both stays and management is not returning my calls. I have contacted the corporate office, but this has not been resolved yet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms, great value!”
Reviews.Author: azlv
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express Lake Buena Vista East is extremely clean. Our rooms were made up daily and upon returning from the parks, it was nice to come back to a fresh and clean room. The beds were comfortable. It was a great value considering the free breakfast offered every morning. Eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, cereals, muffins, bagels, orange juice, and coffee were available every morning and included in the price of the room. The hotel is about a ten minute drive to any of the Disney parks, and is within walking distance to Walmart which is great for picking up last minute things that might have been forgotten. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful and always asking us how we were enjoying our stay, etc. Free wifi and free parking were a big plus. The pool area was also nice though we didn't get to use it as much as I'd have liked. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay near Disney World and on a budget. The only downside, as others have mentioned, are the thin walls. Lucky for us this wasn't a problem and we had quiet neighbors but at one point I could hear the TV next door. In a city with tons of hotel choices, I was very happy we chose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay.... we are grandparents”
Reviews.Author: metzer45
Reviews.Content: traveling with our daughter and 4 year old granddaughter for a trip to Disney. On our arrival at 4 PM they put us in a room with 2 queen beds instead of the kid's suite that I had requested six months earlier. After a 15 minute wait, they rearranged their reservations and gave us the room we had requested. TV worked, as did the refrigerator and microwave. The room was clean and overlooked the pool. Pool was small, but clean and warm and adequate for our needs. Small play area for our granddaughter and a hot tub, next to the pool. Towels were available at poolside. Breakfast room was large with several choices including sausage and biscuits, pancakes, cereals, danish, fruit, juices, coffee, tea and it was all fresh and plentiful. Checkout was easy and the drive to Disney was short and uneventful....just follow signs. The rooms were a little thin on noise prevention, but it did not bother us. With the AC on, we did not hear our neighbors. The beds were comfortable.They do have a shuttle, that I believe drops you at Epcot and you can hop a shuttle from there. We drove to Disney and paid for parking ($14). The place was clean, neat, friendly and I would stay again. Our experience was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “this place rocks”
Reviews.Author: francy113
Reviews.Content: first stayed 3 nights. had to leave but came back 4 days later and stayed for a whole month. first impressions last, the girls, Kellie and Heta, are the reasons we came back. then everyone there seemed to treat us like family. my son brought his family down for 4 nights and they loved it. close with shuttles to all the hot spots. clean rooms, great breakfast, fabulous pool area and on site laundry. after our first stay, they upgraded us to a suite. to this management team and all the girls and guys that make this place the best place i have ever vacationed, we thank you sooo much. we have already booked for a month next year. thanks again don and jerri from michigan

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls, hear everything next door, will never stay here”
Reviews.Author: sbtraveler1095
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel during a convention at the Marriot world center next door. Great location and price but the walls between rooms never were insulated. You can hear every detail next door. The AC is the type that turns on full blast when needed then completely turns off (with out the fan running) so the noise level from the AC is very loud then dead silence. If that does not wake you up every 30 minutes the honey moon couple banging against the wall next door will. Wow I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels with thin walls but never this bad. On the good side they have a full breakfast, free parking, and free internet that worked half the time. I will pay extra at another hotel next year for a good night’s rest.

Reviews.Title: “To expensive for what you get + employees steal+ fidelity program not applicable”
Reviews.Author: Julia155032
Reviews.Content: I will never stay in a Holiday Inn Express again! The service at this hotel is not representative of the Florida/ Walt Disney World experience. They forgot to clean our room several days (we stayed a total of 10 nights!), employees stold some clothes, the room was small and the decoration is out dated. One of the main reasons why we chose this hotel is beacause of the fidelity program offered by the InterContinental Hotel group. There again we were missinformed when we booked because no points were accumulated during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: carla28argentina
Reviews.Content: We were a little bit afraid because it was not the holiday inn we thought we`ve paid but when we got there everything changed for better! Staff was great, rooms clean, fridge, microwave and coffee maker at the room. People during breakfast was helpful and always smiling and kind. Pool was ok, and nothing bad to say. Wallmart is in front of the hotel, the lake buena vista outlet too and many restaurants in the area . Transportation to parks were punctual, wi fi great at the hotel included rooms, so I highly recommed staying at the hotel because you won´t be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol T
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean bed comfortable but like other guests I heard the room next door's cell phone ring and listened to a pretty long conversation at about 10pm if hotel breakfast included with nightly rate was very good and kept fresh. The only thing I really didn't like was a hold on my credit card for $50.00 for extras I don't know what they would be because there was no bar or dining on premise parking was included so was wi-fi so go figure. I did call hotel and they called my bank to have funds released but for some one who is close to credit limit this is very inconvient and not necessary I have stayed at other HI expresses and this is a first.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay - thin walls though”
Reviews.Author: kriskar
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week on a family vacation. Everything was perfect. However, as has been reported in other reviews, the walls allowed sounds from adjacent rooms to come into ours. There was a gentleman coughing on one side and a baby crying on the other. You could also hear the TV from the other rooms. Even though my wife & I are light sleepers, the sounds didn't bother us much as we left the room around 9am for the theme parks and returned at 11pm and just crashed. What worked for me: - Great Location (couple miles from the Disney entrance) - Clean room (no musty odor like some other hotels I stayed at) - Clean bathroom with all necessary toiletries, amply refilled every day - Great hot breakfast (though the line was long every morning) - Very friendly staff What didn't work for me: - Noise permeates from other rooms - High-speed internet is not wireless. You have to connect using an Ethernet cord (provided). However I could not make it work on my laptop. Though I must admit, I had a wireless data card so I did not bother checking with the hotel staff about it. - Bed was somewhat hard (not as bad as the word sounds) - Outdoor pool & hot-tub, though supposedly heated, we couldn't use due to the unusually cold weather for Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our situation and rate was great”
Reviews.Author: newgeezer
Reviews.Content: We needed to spend a couple nights in Orlando and have our niece and nephew stay with us. This hotel was perfect for that. They had family rooms which had a king bed and an alcove with 2 twin beds for the kids. They even had their own TV. We liked the room and the kids loved it. The hotel was clean and service was good. The breakfast was typical HIE fare. Their are plenty of places to eat within a short drive. This room was the cheapest we stayed at during our trip from Virginia to Orlando. The only little down side was the wireless internet was not very speedy in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Price - Staff - Breakfast all wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: norton96
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for all the attractions in Orlando. Clean rooms and friendly staff. The free breakfast had lots of choices and tasted good too. If you are up for a drink and some good inexpensive food at night, try Cheers next to the hotel. If you are looking for a enterainment and dinner at a good price try Capones Dinner theater.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: WallE_Cars
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed in Holiday inn and it was quite a memorable experience. As I was on a business trip, I got the pleasure of choosing Holiday Inn. The location is very near to the Disney Resorts. The shops are all close to it. The service is great and the food is also good. You can bid for the rooms online to get the best deals.

Reviews.Title: “Cole in Distance,miles away in Price.”
Reviews.Author: navywrslr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel while running the Disney World Wine and Dine Half Marathon. THe Hotel looks new,the room was clean,alrge and very comfortable. The free Breakfast was great,large choise of good food. The Hotel is close to Disney,but the coast is miles away,makes visitng Disney affordable. A Shuttle runs from the Hotel to area Theme parks. Lots of Restaurants located near the Hotel. Staff was very friendly. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to WDW and Outlets”
Reviews.Author: micheleneann
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very helpful. Being set back off the road made it less noisy a plus in my book.. I thought the tasty breakfast had good variety, even though I agree with another reviewer on here, there was a need for more than just bananas in the fruit department. Two outlets are within 5 mins. and a Super Walmart was basically next door. Great if you forgot something since it is open 24 hours. ( which I did) WDW is under 10 -15 mins and Sea world 15-20 and Universal took me apx 25mins to their parking garage. Of course that depends on the traffic/ road conditions. ;) I had an upgraded suite type room for my stay. I was so pleased to see how spacious, clean and well maintained . Also a sofa so I could just sit there and watch tv and or snack in comfort. I had an overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Nyah82
Reviews.Content: Good location; perfect for visiting all the theme parks + lots of restaurants nearby, big & clean rooms, very friendly staff. Price really ok.

Reviews.Title: “Best value close to Disney, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Chileheadcraig
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend trip to Disney. It was the best priced hotel very near the attaractions that allowed pets, so thats what got us in the door. The rooms were fairly clean and the rooms had a balcony, which I usually dont see on cheaper rooms. We did see one small roach though on day 2. Breakfast was good, but it could be better. The best thing were the cinnamon buns and the worst was the OJ. There also were no waffle makers which I really like at some places and fruit was limited to bananas only. The pool area was nice with a waterfall and slide as well as a hot tub. That was also a nice suprise! The obvious plus is the location! It took maybe 5 min to get to the park being only one exit away on I-4. It takes longer to get back due to some complicated exits, but its not too bad. Roach and bad OJ aside, we would probably stay here again due to the price, location and the fact that they allow pets.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very nice stay and we will return”
Reviews.Author: kimford
Reviews.Content: nice and clean hotel all around. employes were very helpful and friendly. bathrooms a little small but nice and clean. we frequent kissimmees old town and we will stay here for now on.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ILiveforThisFlorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a softball group and we had a very good experience from check in to check out. Rooms were clean and spacious, accomodating 2 queen beds. For a group of softball girls breakfast was plentiful. It was close to the fields we were playing at (10 min drive). International Drive and the Disney area was very close. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Bmdiver
Reviews.Content: Great location and clean rooms. Our only and biggest problem here was the paper thin walls. We could hear every conversation that the next door couple was having. At 2am the alarm clock for our next door neighbors went off and im guessing that they were not home cause it continued for several minutes until we called down to the front desk who sent someone up to turn it off. The alarm was really loud and all I can say is other than the paper thin walls this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: SquareCaller
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express was convenient ot the attractions and yet very quiet, clean, and comfortable. The Inn was very busy during our stay. For the first two days of our 3-day stay, there was no television available, except fot eh weather channel, as a result of a dispute between the Inn and Direct-TV. The second night the wireless internet we not available. The pool was nice, clean and well used. Breakfast, complete and not the typical continental breakfast, was quite busy, but accessible. Staff was fiendly and helpful. Very apologetic about eh lack of tv and wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel but I won't go back.”
Reviews.Author: chaleab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while visiting Orlando on our "second honeymoon". One thing that was great about this hotel was the continental breakfast. It was hot and delicious with lots of variety, including biscuits and gravy, eggs, bagels, cereal, juice, yogurt, fruit, muffins.....it was wonderful. Also, the rooms were very clean and well-kept. The staff was courteous and kind but couldn't really solve my main problem....which was the paper thin walls. The walls are so thin you can hear entire conversations goin on in the adjoining rooms. People were still up with their excited kids and the tv blaring at 1:00 in the morning. Each time someone upstairs took a step we could hear it as well as feel it. Also the bed was so hard that I had back pain and had to sleep with my hip on top of the pillows. I'm only 27 years old, so it's not like I am frail or anything. The bed was just that firm! Other than that, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located just a few exits down from all the major attractions and is conveniently located right next to a WalMart and many other places to eat and shop. Someone who can sleep through anything and likes their beds firm wouldn't have any problem. I, however, will not stay here again. Sleep is too important to me!

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rcoola21
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thinking it was the same place I stayed a few times years ago. It turns out they took the name but the other Holiday Inn now has a different name. I called The Holiday Inn 1 800 number and was told there were shuttles every half an hour to the parks. Big lie! One to go in the morning and one to come back when the parks close. Nothing during the day. I also asked that same number about airport shuttle service. Was told no problem there is bus service again every half hour for $19 each way. That shuttle didn't stop at this Holiday Inn. I asked for a suite. Was given a room with a king size bed and a pull out couch. I asked for first floor near the lobby and a handicap room with a room next door for my kids. The person who booked my room read the instrutions back to me. When I arrived at the hotel they said there wasn't any special instructions. My room was on one side of the building and my kids were on the other. I paid in full in advance months ago. I asked for a refund and that request was denied. The assistant manager Heta was helpful and gave us a free upgrade to a real suites next to each other. I began to calm down until the next day. They began to charge my credit card multiple times for no know reason. Started as $50, went to $127. That was the first day. The second day there were two $380 charges. By the third day they were adding $500 charges. Most were removed with lots of complaining. We came home yesterday and 2 still remain. Breakfast was decent even if it was just an upgraded continental breakfast. The line was always long and food was gone quickly. There were so many more issues. Just glad it's over and I am home. Won't be going back to that place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family-hotel”
Reviews.Author: Squix
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel with good value and excellent service in perfect location. No matter what you want to do in orlando, it's a good place to stay. Sea World, Disney World, Universal Studios and Outlet Malls are only a few minutes away by using the car. The hotel-rooms are large with your own kitchen and nice bathroom. Wifi is for free and reachable in the rooms. Next to the reception there is a service counter to book any events. We had to change our date for Discovery Cove because it was a very rainy day. Our english language is not the best, so the women of the counter did the phone call over half an hour with the management of Discovery Cove to change our date from friday to saturday. Also there is a nice pool and bar where you can hang out after such an eventfull day and some places where the kids can play. Anyway it's a really nice hotel and i would come back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for large tour groups!”
Reviews.Author: VacationCsar
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a large tour group of teenagers and it was a great choice. The free breakfast was great and offered something for everyone from cereal to bacon and eggs. The rooms were large & clean and the beds were very comfortable. The management was great to work with - I had to rearrange the rooms for my group about 10 times and it was never a problem. The kids enjoyed the large pool and game room. It is an easy 15 minute drive to the Disney theme parks from this hotel. For the price and amenities, you can't beat this place!

Reviews.Title: “Hours”
Reviews.Author: shonufff
Reviews.Content: The staff was very professional and nice to us. The only thing that could have been better were the pool hours. They closed at 11pm and my colleagues and I wanted to sit and talk but could not... Additionally, the wireless internet service was terrible slow and sometimes connection was lost. So there was no late night work unless!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: desanddust
Reviews.Content: The free shuttles to and from Disney and Universal were very convenient. It is a great location - not too far from either destination. The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful. Breakfast was good - go early because line gets long. The only downside was that you could hear noise from the adjoining rooms. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice lobby, simple yet clean rooms, good breakfast, clean overall”
Reviews.Author: kinematic11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms which were separated by one room of which was a load family. you could hear the mother cleary through the walls. They had a tickle fight and we heard the whole thing. The bathroom mirror is not framed, like in a Hampton inn, but it was clean. the rooms are comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. we were happy to come back to the hotel and had no complaints. breakfast was very good and included in the price. i ate several yogurts and eggs. we will stay here again. walmart is across the street and it is huge and has a ton of souveniers. there is an outlet mall right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “A great centralized location with excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: codyp38
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great-centralized location with an excellent staff. The staff was kind friendly willing to accommodate all of their guests. I had an awesome experience!!! ~Marcia Butler

Reviews.Title: “Please dont choose this hotel it was a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Tish_22
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights, the pool was filthy the bathroom stink even before you use it. It smells like sewage. The so called hot breakfast was finished as soon as it was placed. One person made all the breakfast served and cleaned. One morning after waiting in line for 2 HOURS I had to walk to walmart the closest place to feed my kids.

Reviews.Title: “great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: lanaspradling
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Florida for a week long football tournament for our son, the hotel was very centrally located to where we needed to go, as well as very close to Disney world and and nearby restaurants and amusements, but it wasnt to busy. The hotel was tucked back off the street and very quiet. The hotel was clean, staff friendly, breakfast was a full hot breakfast, pool was nice. Theres not one bad thing I could say about this property. We picked it out not knowing anything about the area or the premesis and we were not disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: Melonville
Reviews.Content: Terrible location. I stay in HIE across north America and this is not up to to the HIE standard. The breakfast bar closes at 930 am sharp. If there are 'customers' in line, oh well. The lights are turned off and the food is taken away. There are NO amenities on or off site within walking distance with the exception of a Wal-Mart SuperCentre. We tried to get a taxi one night so that we could go to a restaurant but the front desk refused to make the call for us unless we agreed to utilize the limousine company affiliated with the property. What a racket. We stayed for seven days but our bed linen was never changed during that time. Nice hot tub but closes at 10pm sharp - if that doesn't fit into your relaxing vacation plan then too bad. Free WIFI is a joke - poor service, poor connectivity. Our initial impression of this hotel, weed infested front landing complete with a half dozen abandoned shopping carts, should have been enough to make me back out of our reservation and move to another property but we stuck it out...to the detriment of our entire vacation. AVOID THIS PROPERTY LIKE THE PLAGUE. Poor property run by poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: TeaInLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Expedia and had read the TripAdvisor reviews beforehand so knew some of the "issues" other reviewers had with this property. We were well pleased with this hotel and would say that it is excellent value for money. Location is excellent, just down the road from a huge Wal-Mart and around the corner (within walking distance) from a superb outlet mall. (By the way, there's an Irish Pub at the back of the outlet mall that serves, among other things, Irish Breakfast.) Front desk very accomodating/friendly. Our room was appealing and very clean. Bed was VERY comfortable. Bathroom was spotless; nice towels. Maid service was excellent. Our room (244) overlooked the pool (which we didn't use but it looked beautiful). USA Today delivered on weekdays. The breakfast area was very clean and attractive. We thought the breakfast itself was great. (We knew that it ended at 9:30 but that was never a problem for us.) The only negative was that yes, the walls seemed a bit thin (re: noise) but to tell you the truth, by the time we returned to our room every evening we were so knackered that we fell asleep quickly and whatever muffled sounds we *may* have heard were not a problem for us. We would recommend this property and will definitely stay here again the next time we return to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: pointybubble
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Holiday Inn Expresses around the country and have always had a great experience. I love the breakfasts that they provide and booked a room at this hotel expressly because of the value that I felt I was getting with the breakfast included in the price. However, I was very disappointed with our stay. The major concern is the noise level. When I read the reviews here on TripAdvisor, I thought to myself, "how bad can it really be?". I thought the other reviewers were just being sensitive, and since I have pretty bad hearing, that I would be fine. This was not the case as the walls really are THAT THIN. We heard our neighbors talking at a normal conversational level- that shouldn't happen in a hotel. I've stayed at quite a few hotels and have never experienced this before. If you don't normally sleep in noisy conditions such as with the TV on- STAY AWAY. And if you decide to stay anyway, please be courteous and mindful that your neighbors can hear everything you do. My next concern was the famous breakfast that I chose this hotel for. My group headed down to the breakfast area at 9:30am, only to find it had already closed- what?? Could they really close it that early? They sure did. I was very unhappy about this. Not only do they heavily and aggressively market their breakfast only to close it in the middle of the morning, but there was no communication from the hotel about this. No flyers, no signs, nothing said about the breakfast at check-in. While we could have gone to the trouble of calling up or stopping by the front desk, I don't think it is something you should have to worry about when you are on vacation. You pick a hotel that includes breakfast because you don't want to have to worry about going out and finding it- which you will if you like to sleep in even a little at this hotel! The location was odd, but not bad. It is nearby a Wal-Mart and is a few minutes by car from Disney, but it is tucked away from the road behind a plaza and is very easy to miss. The rooms were clean and fairly standard. The included fridge and microwave were nice although we did not use them. I really wanted to like this hotel but I really can not recommend it. Unless you like NOISY HOTEL ROOMS and GETTING UP EARLY I would pass on it- there are many other hotels to pick from in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: 197FIFI
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 night. The best thing we like about this hotel is the breakfast, it has a good selection to choose from including eggs, sausages, muffins, cinnamon buns, bagels, bananas, juices, yogurt, milk, coffee..etc. The room is clean and the beds are comfortable. The front desk staff is friendly. The hotel has shuttle bus service to Disney and Sea World, but the returning schedule doesn't coincide with the theme parks' closing hours, so if you want to stay till closing, you have to find other means of transportation back to hotel. Overall, it's good value for the price we paid .

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: ariosto
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is good, good price and CONVENIENT location.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express Minus but better than expected: Read On!”
Reviews.Author: BAD-UNCLE-DAVE
Reviews.Content: Understand what criteria is really important to you in a hotel! That will better give you an understanding if this property works for you or not. We spent 9 nights at this hotel and were overall very satisfied. 1, Noise / Hearing other guests through the walls as regularly discussed: NOT AN ISSUE in our stay, 2. Hotel Management Staff: Almost excellent! 3. Maid Staff: Questionable which lowers the overall rating of this property. 4. Hotel Location: Farthest Hotel that I have stayed from Disney properties and that is a minus, 5. Breakfast: Good but not up to par with most other Holiday Inn Express properties. Layed out poorly, service questionable and less food options, 6. Super Walmart: Across the street and for us was a major benefit as we had plenty of needs that a store like this could provide and at excellent prices, 7, Pool: Meets Standards for a Hotel of this level. 8, Parking: Meets Standards Strengths and Weaknesses: The choice is yours based on your needs but overall we have no regrets in comitting to staying at this property and would consider returning in the future,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and very clean”
Reviews.Author: gatorkeene
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The staff was the best part of the stay, very helpful nice. Room are clean pool was nice. I only had one issue and it was the walls. You can here your neighbors makin noise, more so when they have a out of control 4 year old!!!!! I asked to move and there was no question it was taken care of within 5 min. When you spend over 100 nights a year on the road its nice to find a hotel you feel at home at, cause there hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine”
Reviews.Author: mariamexico
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 friends stayed overnight for our trip to sea world.. When we arrived in the evening I was really delighted at how clean and cute the lobby was. Check-in took very little time as there was no one else there at the moment. Our room was clean when we arrived and had a microwave and mini fridge. Since there were four of us I went to the front desk and asked for more toiletries and towels and they gave them to me right away with no problems... Included in the price was breakfast which had plenty to choose from.. the lobby had tables and chairs for you to sit. The only complaints I would have is yes the walls are thin. We heard every word our neighbors were saying as they got ready, so please be courteous and keep your voice low in the morning while you get ready :) Also the extra lock on the door was broken, but it was just the one to keep the maid out while you are there, not the main lock. The bathroom was nice, clean and even painted a pretty light blue :) Overall I have to say that I was really satisfied with the hotel. I wish we had time to go in the pool, which looked nice and had some tables and lounge chairs around it. There was also a small game room but it was closed when we arrived. I did notice it was open during breakfast though! Air hockey anyone???? I recommend this hotel.. It was clean and fine for a short stay...

Reviews.Title: “Nice contemporary clean room for your money,but thin walls -- bring earplugs?”
Reviews.Author: DeeL9
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The room was modern, nice and clean. Overall this hotel is a good value for what you pay for. The free contintental breakfast is also good. It's relatively close to Disney theme parks. Rent a car, it's easier than taking the bus and you have your freedom. For those who care about noise I did have one gripe, as noted in another review -- the walls are pretty thin. I checked in late around 11 pm and was talking with my spouse in the room. We were chatting and laughing about our terrible experience in a hotel down the street that we couldn't bear to stay in (see my other review). Suddenly we heard some loud banging on the wall. We didn't think we were that loud. We assumed they could hear us and wanted us to be quiet, so we did the neighborly thing and quieted down. We stayed in a room on the top floor. Overnight I kept hearing the A/C on the roof go off. It vibrated tremendously and was pretty loud. The vibrations were strong enough to shake the lamp shades on the wall sconces. Maybe I am too light of a sleeper?? I awoke to the sounds of my neighbors on both sides talking and laughing as no doubt they were getting ready to go to Disney World. The walls are pretty thin and you can hear the conversations next door. I had earplugs from my flight, so I didn't mind. My spouse who's a heavy sleeper didn't have any problems with the noises. One other minor gripe. The toilet broke. It wouldn't flush because the handle popped out. With a little ingenuity I saw the problem and fixed it. But I am 100% sure that it will pop out again, hopefully it will not be for your stay. It could've been the room we were in, but don't stay on the top floor. Originally the guy wanted to put us in a room on the first floor -- Silly me thought the higher up you are, the less noise there would be. Lesson learned -- at least for this place. Overall I would definitely stay here again, but not on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room; thin walls”
Reviews.Author: OldWorldEurope
Reviews.Content: I think this is a brand new hotel. We had trouble finding it at night because they don't have a lighted sign on the street. The lobby is beautiful, the room was fabulous - high ceilings, king-size bed, microwave, roomy bathroom, HOWEVER, the walls are paper thin. We could hear our neighbors' conversation -- not just a low mumbling, but their actual words -- and we could hear clock radio alarms go off in the morning. The complimentary breakfast was one of the better we've had and there is plenty of room to sit down and eat it -- many hotels have little or no room for sitting. I would stay there again if I could get a room that wasn't right next to other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Changed my mind after this trip”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELALL48
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review a couple of weeks ago after I had stayed at this hotel in Feb. At the time I had given a positive review. I did not experience any of the thin wall issues last time. The last time I had been upgraded to a 2 room suite because I am a platinum member of their program, and I experienced no issues with the thin walls. This time it went downhill from the very beginning. I had reserved a 2 room suite that is at the end of their building. I was informed when I showed up that a guest had stayed over and I was put in one of thier regular rooms. No way to even get the lower rate since I was prepaid. I was told when I checked in that a 2 room suite was available for the rest of my 4 night stay the next night. I stayed in the regular room and experienced the horror of the thin walls. People next door came in around 11 pm and talked and laughed until 2. These walls are truly terrible! No sleep because on both sides as long as your neighbors are awake, so are you. When I went down the next morning there was no record of my reservation for the suite and was informed I would not be able to get to the room that I had reserved for the entire stay. To top the entire stay off, they never got to my room to clean until after 5 pm. Last night my neighbors again were having a good time until well after midnight. Then this morning I had my cell phone alarm set for 5am because I am here on business. They had the nerve to bang on my wall because my cell phone alarm went off. That is right, my cell phone alarm was loud enough to make them mad! This hotel is fairly clean, breakfast is fairly good, location is great, but if you have any expectations of sleep, forget it! I know I gave it a good review before, but this has been the trip from h ll! If you must stay here, stay in the 2 room suites or forget it. After all, your ultimate goal from a hotel is to get a good night sleep right? This has been miy biggest disappointment yet in HI Express. Get a good night sleep, stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: Travelers2213
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a quick Disney trip over a long weekend. For this trip we just needed a decent room, not a great romantic holiday. So this was the perfect hotel. 10 minutes from Disney. Clean, quiet room. Breakfast included. Very helpful staff. We bought our tickets at the concierge and avoided big lines at the parks. Free shuttle to the parks at scheduled times (we considered it but chose to drive to have more flexibility).

Reviews.Title: “No Issue at all, Going again next week.”
Reviews.Author: KStravel54
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this HI for 3 nights last month while in town for a conference. Was very concerned about the thin wall "noise" issues in most of the other reviews. I am glad to say that I had no issues with it at all. Maybe I was lucky and had quiet neighbors, but was pleasantly surprised. Convenient location to all attractions if that is what you are in town for. Also convenient to Convention Center (ten minutes) and the Gaylord (5 minutes) Also, with a prepaid (non-cancel) reservation, got the room for $69 per night. Am going for another conference next week for 4 nights and have booked it again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, other than the noise factor!”
Reviews.Author: kjk411
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 2 nights here. Pretty much a typical HIE property. Good breakfast, reliable shuttle to Disney, fairly large swimming pool and hot jacuzzi. My major issue, as with many others who have written reviews, would be the noise. Noise from floors above, hallways, and especially next door neighbors. If that type of noise doesn't bother you, go for it! Front desk were very helpful and pleasant to deal with. Could not get the wireless signal to work in the room, but there was a high-speed connection to use in the room or a business office on the 1st floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...as expected.”
Reviews.Author: MELIPR
Reviews.Content: I stayed there over the weekend. Our check-in at midnight was really fast, room changes were made with no problems. Breakfast...a big plus on our stay. Complete, refill constantly and for a hotel buffet it was very good. Rooms were clean, smell ok and everything in place. Its located close to dinning, shops and very closed to the parks. The downside the walls, its like not having them at all. If you are lucky enough not to have neighboors you are all set! But for us, the wall matter did not ruined our vacation. I have been to hotels were walls are in cement and still got woken up by people screaming on the hallways. Overall I like this hotel, would reccommended to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy with a capital N”
Reviews.Author: jmichael-6
Reviews.Content: When previous reviewers talk of the thin walls, believe it. You can hear low-level conversation as if it were taking place in your room. Same with the hallway. We were awakened by the many children excited about their Disney adventure every morning. Thinnest walls we have ever experienced. No other complaints, but this one is a significant one.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel and Suites Orlando-Lake Buena Vista East
